snippet: A winter-long miasma of smoke and dust is the new normal in Tehran and many other cities, so much so that fatalistic Iranians simply pretend that the sky is blue and the air is clean....
abstract: Tehran Journal; Iranians have begun to accept thick blanket of smog that regularly descends on Tehran as new normal, despite its dire health risks; smog levels began rising after sanctions forced Iran to refine its own gasoline; officials are at loss over how to address problem and citizens largely choose to ignore it.
lead_paragraph: A winter-long miasma of smoke and dust is the new normal in Tehran and many other cities, so much so that fatalistic Iranians simply pretend that the sky is blue and the air is clean.

headline.print_headline: As a Noxious Smog Descends,  Iranians Adjust to the New Normal
headline.main: As a Noxious Smog Descends, Tehran Tries to Ignore It
